medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset abdominal pain localized to the bilateral lower quadrants.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain began at midnight prior to presentation, described as sharp, constant, and localized. The pain worsened since the night prior, and he was unable to sleep due to discomfort. He experienced one episode of nonbilious emesis and was febrile to 101.2 early that morning, which prompted him to come to the ER. His nausea has since resolved, but he has experienced similar pain in the past, though not to this severity.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Depression/anxiety, alcohol abuse; past surgical history includes left varicocele, bilateral inguinal hernia repair, and excision of a cyst of the right testicle.
